document.masterDocTitle: Five new species of Phaonia Robineau-Desvoidy (Diptera: Muscidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Five new species of Phaonia Robineau-Desvoidy (Diptera: Muscidae) from China

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Institute of Entomology, Shenyang Normal University, Shenyang 110034, China.
College of Life Science, Shenyang Normal University, Shenyang 110034, China.

heading.emphasis:
Addendum to the key to species of the
Phaonia errans
group from Ma, Xue & Feng (2002) (males)

paragraph.keyLead:
1. Fore tarsus without sensory hairs on the ventral surface (
Phaonia simulans
subgroup).............................. 2

- Fore tarsus with sensory hairs on the ventral surface (
Phaonia errans
subgroup)................................... 9

3. Fore tibia with 1–2 median p ; frons about 1.5x as wide as the distance between out margin of posterior ocellus; parafacial about 1.8x as wide as postpedicel............................................................
P. rectoides Xue, 1996

- Fore tibia without median p ; frons about 1.5x as wide as anterior ocellus; parafacial not wider than postpedicel.............................................................................................
P. liujiayui Xue
sp. nov.

5. Dm-cu crossvein curved as S shaped; Coxae and tarsi black; parafacial slightly narrower than postpedicel; the end of surstyli is pointed in profile................................................................
P. asierrans Zinovjev, 1981

- Dm-cu crossvein slightly straight; Coxae and tarsi fuscous; parafacial about 2/3 of postpedicel in width; the end of surstyli is broad in profile...........................................................
P. fulvescenticoxa Feng & Ma, 2002

8. Antenna brown; hind femur with pv in distal 1/3................................
P. jinfengshanensis Feng & Ma, 2002

- Antenna black; hind femur without pv ................................................
P. wangpingga Xue
sp. nov.

13. Frons about 2.0x as wide as anterior ocellus; basal half of palpus brown............
P. suberrans Feng in Ma & Feng, 1989

- Frons subequal to the width of anterior ocellus; palpus black..........................
P. tianmushanensis Xue
sp. nov.

14. Fore tibia with 2–3 median p ..............................................
P. mimerrans Ma in Ma & Feng, 1989

16. Calypter light yellow; halter yellow.....................................................
P. latierrans Xue, 1996

- Calypter brownish yellow; halter light reddish brown..................................
P. xinierrans Feng & Ye, 2009

17. Upper half of frons with setulae-like fr row; distal half of scutellum orangered; all tergites without middle black vitta.......................................................................................
P. errans ( Meigen, 1826 )

- Upper half of frons bare; only the end and lateral margins of scutellum light brownish-red; at least tergite 1+2 and tergite 3 with middle black vittae..........................................................
P. rufivulgaris Xue & Wang, 1989

19. Dm-cu crossvein slightly bent; fr row in full, small setulae-like on upper half of frons; hind femur without pv ......................................................................................
P. youyuensis Xue & Wang, 1989

- Dm-cu crossvein distinctly bent; fr row incomplete, upper half of frons bare; hind femur with 2 pv ........
P. fissa Xue, 1984

21. Basicosta brown; crossveins r-m and dm-cu not clouded......................................
P. bulanga Xue, 1996

- Basicosta black; crossveins r-m and dm-cu clouded............................
P. nigrierrans Cui, Zhang & Xue, 1998

22. Sternite 1 bare; presutural of scutum with black vittae...............................
P. tristriolata Ma & Wang, 1992
- Sternite 1 setulose; presutural of scutum without black vittae.................................................. 23

23. Frons narrower, about half width of anterior ocellus; parafacial distinctly narrower than postpedical; body length 5.0 mm.....................................................................
P. chaoyangensis Zhang, Cui & Wang, 1993

- Frons subequal to the width of the distance between out margin of posterior ocellus; parafacial about 2.0x as wide as postpedical; body length 7.0–11.0 mm............................................
P. shanxiensis Zhang, Zhao & Wu, 1985
